intro: Tracanthelium salignum, commonly known as the salt marsh thistle, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions. It thrives in saline and brackish environments, showcasing its adaptability to high salt concentrations. The plant features spiny leaves and purple flowers, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its root system helps stabilize soil in marshy areas, preventing erosion. Tracanthelium salignum plays an important ecological role in coastal ecosystems.
